Action: # Application State Change: Update Request Rejection

Create an Update Request for a journal that does not have a current Update Request.  Make a change that will be fairly easy to review from the ToC (e.g. the APC amount).  Take a note of the Journal's ToC URL
Locate the Update Request created in the previous step from the admin area search

Expected Test Results: The record contains the value "Update Request For: [journal id]"

Action: Click the "Unlock and Close" button / close the window
Go to the "My update requests" page of the publisher dashboard

Expected Test Results: The update request is no longer visible

Action: Find the Update Request again via the search (e.g. filter by Rejected and sort by last updated most recent first)
Click the "Unlock and Close" button / close the window
Go to the "My update requests" page of the publisher dashboard

Expected Test Results: The update request is visible again in the status "Pending"

Action: Find the Update Request again via the search (e.g. filter by Pending and sort by last updated most recent first)

Expected Test Results: The record contains the value "Update Request For: [journal id]"

Action: Click the "Unlock and Close" button / close the window

Expected Test Results: The Journal page has been updated with the new information from the Update Request (e.g the updated APC amount)

Action: Search for the Journal's ISSN in the admin journal search

Expected Test Results: There is only one Journal published in DOAJ with that ISSN

Action: Find the accepted application via the admin search (e.g. filter by Accepted and sort by last updated most recent first)

Create an Update Request for a journal that does not have a current Update Request.  Make a change that will be fairly easy to review from the ToC (e.g. the APC amount).  Take a note of the Journal's ToC URL
Locate the Update Request created in the previous step from the admin area search

Create another Update Request for the same journal.  Make a change that will be fairly easy to review from the ToC (e.g. the APC amount) AND which is different from the change made before.  Take a note of the Journal's ToC URL
Locate the new Update Request created in the previous step in the admin search area

Expected Test Results: The Journal page has been updated with the new information from the Update Request (e.g the updated APC amount)

Action: Search for the Journal's ISSN in the admin journal search

Expected Test Results: There is only one Journal published in DOAJ with that ISSN

Action: Find the accepted application via the admin search (e.g. filter by Accepted and sort by last updated most recent first)

Create an Update Request for a journal that does not have a current Update Request.  Make a change that will be fairly easy to review from the ToC (e.g. the APC amount).  Take a note of the Journal's ToC URL
Locate the Update Request created in the previous step from the admin area search

Create another Update Request for the same journal.  Make a change that will be fairly easy to review from the ToC (e.g. the APC amount) AND which is different from the change made before.  Take a note of the Journal's ToC URL
Locate the first Update Request in the admin area search

Expected Test Results: You receive an error message saying that the Update Request cannot be unrejected

Action: Create an Update Request for a journal that does not have a current Update Request.  Make a change that will be fairly easy to review from the ToC (e.g. the APC amount).  Take a note of the Journal's ToC URL
Locate the Update Request created in the previous step from the admin area search

Create another Update Request for the same journal.  Make a change that will be fairly easy to review from the ToC (e.g. the APC amount) AND which is different from the change made before.  Take a note of the Journal's ToC URL
Locate the Update Request created in the previous step from the admin area search
Locate the first Update Reques in the admin area search (e.g. filter by Rejected and order by last updated, oldest first - the record we want should be the second one on the list)

Expected Test Results: The Journal page has been updated with the new information from the first Update Request (e.g the updated APC amount)

Action: Search for the Journal's ISSN in the admin journal search

Expected Test Results: There is only one Journal published in DOAJ with that ISSN

Action: Find the accepted application via the admin search (e.g. filter by Accepted and sort by last updated most recent first)
